abstract.para: This topic describes what &productname; (&productnameshort;) is, of which components it consists, and what the benefits of using &productnameshort; are.

section.title: What is &productnameshort;?
section.para: The &productnameshort; service is a locally hosted generative AI. It provides secure auditable AI capabilities and allows organizations to deploy AI models on their own infrastructure using &slm;. The service ensures complete control over data and compliance with regulatory requirements.

section.title: How does &productnameshort; work?
section.para: &productnameshort; is designed to run on cluster nodes. Each cluster node consists of a foundation stack of services and a set of AI-related container images deployed from the &rancheappco;.

listitem.para: &slm; as the underlying operating system with the optional &nvidia; driver installed.
&rancheprime; ensuring container and application lifecycle management.
An implementation of a large language model (LLM).
An extensible Web user interface for the &ollama; LLM runner.
A vector database built for generative AI applications with minimal performance loss.
Enables &nvidia; GPU computing power and capabilities for processing AI-related tasks.

section.title: Benefits of using &productnameshort;
section.para: Running the &productnameshort; service brings the following benefits:

listitem.para: Non-local AI services raise concerns about data security and accessibility. Locally hosted AI, however, increases data privacy, security and compliance with regulatory standards.
&productnameshort; provides a user-friendly interface for managing and deploying AI models.
Pre-built &nvidia; drivers and operator provide increased AI performance.
&productnameshort; components are dynamically scalable, from the Web user interface to the underlying data store.
&productnameshort; cares about security—it uses TLS certificates for Web UI and API access. Data stored in a database are encrypted as well.
